Charon.Text: Charon is the largest moon of Pluto and is unique in that it is so large relative to Pluto that they are sometimes considered a double dwarf planet system.  Pluto and Charon orbit a mutual barycenter which lies outside of Pluto itself.
Factoids: Composed primarily of water ice with a small amount of rock.
Has a reddish-brown polar region known as Mordor Macula, thought to be composed of tholins.
Exhibits signs of past geological activity, including canyons and cliffs.

Nix.Text: Nix is one of Pluto's smaller moons. It orbits Pluto and Charon in a complex gravitational dance and is believed to be composed primarily of water ice.
Factoids: Discovered in 2005 by the Hubble Space Telescope.
Has a highly reflective surface, indicating it is covered in water ice.
Exhibits a chaotic rotation, tumbling unpredictably as it orbits Pluto.

Hydra.Text: Hydra is one of Pluto's smaller moons. It orbits Pluto and Charon in a complex gravitational dance and is believed to be composed primarily of water ice.
Factoids: Discovered in 2005 by the Hubble Space Telescope.
Has a highly reflective surface, indicating it is covered in water ice.
Exhibits a chaotic rotation, tumbling unpredictably as it orbits Pluto.

Kerberos.Text: Kerberos is one of Pluto's smaller moons. It orbits Pluto and Charon in a complex gravitational dance and is believed to be composed primarily of water ice.
Factoids: Discovered in 2011 by the Hubble Space Telescope.
Has a dark surface, indicating it may be covered in a layer of tholins.
Exhibits a chaotic rotation, tumbling unpredictably as it orbits Pluto.

Styx.Text: Styx is one of Pluto's smaller moons. It orbits Pluto and Charon in a complex gravitational dance and is believed to be composed primarily of water ice.
Factoids: Discovered in 2012 by the Hubble Space Telescope.
Has a dark surface, indicating it may be covered in a layer of tholins.
Exhibits a chaotic rotation, tumbling unpredictably as it orbits Pluto.
